attributes.action: Equal access to baby changing facilities in both men's and women's toilets.
attributes.additional_details:
Without access to changing tables, parents often use other surfaces to change diapers -- including restroom floors or counters. These unsanitary conditions can pose health risks. 
No mom or dad should ever have to worry about finding a safe, sanitary place to change their baby. 

Requiring public building, shopping centres, cinemas to have a changing facility accessible to both men and women, promotes health and gender equality.
attributes.background: Baby changing facilities in public buildings, cinemas, supermarkets, restarants, shopping centres are traditionally designed in the female's toilets. This tradition does not correpond to the role which fathers play today.
